headline: A Smoke Break Before Surgery
abstract: In a new study, the health agency urges hospitals and surgeons to play a bigger role to help the worldâ€™s 1 billion smokers kick the habit.
lead_paragraph: It goes without saying that cigarettes and surgery are not a winning combination. Scores of studies have shown that patients who use tobacco have poorer post-surgical outcomes. But many doctors give smokers conflicting advice on the ideal length of time they should go cold turkey before  their operations.
